dct_description_sm: Published Oct. 1890 T.C. Mendenhall Superintendent. Verified B.A. Colonna Assistant in charge of Office (Date of first Publication 1870) ; Triangulation by R.D. Cutts and J.J. Gilbert Assistants ; Topography by C. Rockwell ; Hydrography of the Entrance from a survey by the Corps of Engineers, U.S.A. ; [and by] E. Cordell and C. Rockwell Assistants ; Astronomical observations by G. Davidson and R.D. Cutts Assists ; Magnetic observations by G. Davidson...and W. Eimbeck, Sub-Asst., and Lieut Comdr. H.E. Nichols, U.S.N. Assistant ; Verification of Hydrography by Comdr. C.M. Thomas U.S.N. Inspector of Hydrography.
Depths shown by soundings and isolines; relief by contours and spot heights
Bar scales in statute miles, nautical miles, kilometres
Buoy legend, explanatory notes, coordinates of lighthouses, tidal information, Telegraph and signal station notes
Shows drainage, vegetation, "Sand Island," roads, railroad, topography
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Map Collections courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact Branner Earth Sciences Library & Map Collections at brannerlibrary@stanford.edu.
